short_description: Discover the charming microstate of Andorra, nestled in the Pyrenees mountains between France and Spain. Experience world-class skiing, tax-free shopping, stunning alpine landscapes, and rich Catalan culture in this unique European principality.

alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, supermarkets, and shops

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though service charge may be included
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Andorra has a high mountain climate with cold, snowy winters and mild, pleasant summers. The weather varies significantly with altitude, with higher elevations experiencing more extreme conditions.

when_to_visit.title: Winter Ski Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cold and snowy conditions perfect for skiing and winter sports. Andorra's ski resorts are world-renowned, offering excellent slopes and facilities. Great time for winter activities and apr√®s-ski

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild and pleasant temperatures ideal for hiking, mountain biking, and outdoor activities. Perfect for exploring the natural beauty of the Pyrenees, visiting Romanesque churches, and enjoying the mountain scenery

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.time_period: April to May, September to October
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild temperatures with beautiful seasonal colors. Great for sightseeing, shopping, and enjoying the cultural attractions without the winter crowds. Ideal for hiking and exploring the capital

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Andorra depends on your interests: visit during winter (December to March) for world-class skiing, or during summer (June to August) for hiking and outdoor activities in the beautiful Pyrenees mountains
